intro: Didymopanax weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's pachypodium, is a member of the Araliaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its thick, woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by spherical, fleshy fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
